Summary: Clear starry night, dimly illuminated object crossing sky suddenly became very bright forseveral seconds, dimmed down then disappeared away.
divs: sighting detailsa friend and myself were sitting out on his dock on lost lake in groton, mass. trying to pick out constellations and satellites. as an avid skywatcher and being ex-military i am pretty familiar with sky-borne objects one is likely to see in the both day and night. with orion at our 12 o'clock position i picked up an object at roughly the 9 o'clock, heading to the 12, and pointed it out. it appeared to be a satellite - a dot of light - however it was not where you would expect one with respect to the horizon; it seemed lower. within seconds it became very bright, not a sudden flash but a quick build. it continued to moving, dimmed, returned to original state and then faded off. at no time were trails, flashing, or blinking observed. our own reactions to it were surprise. given the myriad of possiblities, especially with night observations, it was, as we both agreed, something we'd not ever seen before. now, this is not quite true as i had observed exactly the same type of thing about a week prior from my home. also, approx. a month before that i observed a very bright light descend straight down from its position in the sky. by that i mean it did not behave like an aircraft in normal flight. the sky to the back of my home is quite busy in terms of flight paths and i am very familiar with them and the behaviors of the aircraft so my initial reaction while watching it fall\descend was that a plane was in trouble. it came down straight as an arrow for several seconds until lower clouds suddenly obscured my view of it. night sky was relatively clear with some lower cloud cover. i have observed meteorites, space junk, over time shooting through the night sky and it did not have any of the many characteristics i have observed. the following day there were no reports of a plane going down.
